metadata.title: CVE-2023-3567 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in vcs_read in drivers/tty/vt/vc_screen.cin vc_screen in the Linux Kernel. This issue may allow an attacker withlocal user access to cause a system crash or leak internal kernelinformation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-5.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic - 5.15.0-72.79
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-72-generic-64k - 5.15.0-72.79
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-42-generic - 5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-42-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1
